column4: I have an issue with spamassassin and claws-mail that's probably easily fixable. Can anyone help me?
where do I put the spamd daemon so it starts at boot
nope that's not the right one
that's where I thought also, but it doesn't start. Rather, that doesn't fix the problem. Let me check if it starts
add symlink to it in /etc/rcS.d and make sure it starts with capital S
how exactly do I make a syslink. the readme isn't as descriptive as I would like.
run the script at startup. That's all.
not what it does. How do I make one
symlink? it's like a shortcut on your file system. ln -s path/to/original /path/to/symlink
right I remember learning about that. Thanks
